contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will richly provide for you an entrance into the eternal kingdom" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: πλουσίως ἐπιχορηγηθήσεται ὑμῖν ἡ εἴσοδος εἰς τὴν αἰώνιον βασιλείαν
contextId.glQuote: there will be richly provided for you an entrance into the eternal kingdom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when he heard a voice come from the Majestic Glory" or "when he heard the voice of the Majestic Glory speak to him" or "when the Majestic Glory spoke to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: φωνῆς ἐνεχθείσης αὐτῷ ... ὑπὸ τῆς Μεγαλοπρεποῦς Δόξης
contextId.glQuote: when a voice was brought to him by the Majestic Glory

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "way of truth" refers to the Christian faith as the true path to God. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "unbelievers will blaspheme the way of truth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the way of truth will be blasphemed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where he will keep them in chains of lower darkness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: to be kept in chains of lower darkness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will destroy them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])

The word "them" refers to the false teachers. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has reserved the gloom of thick darkness for them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἷς ὁ ζόφος τοῦ σκότους τετήρηται
contextId.glQuote: The gloom of thick darkness is reserved for them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active terms. Alternate translation: "the holy commandment that God delivered to them" or "the holy commandment that God made sure that they received" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the holy commandment delivered to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the words that the holy prophets spoke in the past" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῶν προειρημένων ῥημάτων, ὑπὸ τῶν ἁγίων προφητῶν
contextId.glQuote: the words spoken in the past by the holy prophets

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the command of our Lord and Savior, which your apostles gave to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τῆς τῶν ἀποστόλων ὑμῶν ἐντολῆς τοῦ Κυρίου καὶ Σωτῆρος
contextId.glQuote: the command of our Lord and Savior given through your apostles

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God established the heavens and the earth ... long ago by his word" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐρανοὶ ἦσαν ἔκπαλαι, καὶ γῆ … συνεστῶσα τῷ τοῦ Θεοῦ λόγῳ
contextId.glQuote: the heavens and the earth came to exist ... long ago, by God's command

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God flooded the world that existed at that time with water and destroyed it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ὁ τότε κόσμος ὕδατι κατακλυσθεὶς ἀπώλετο
contextId.glQuote: the world of that time was destroyed, being flooded with water

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God, by that same word, has reserved the heavens and the earth for fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οἱ ... οὐρανοὶ καὶ ἡ γῆ, τῷ αὐτῷ λόγῳ τεθησαυρισμένοι εἰσὶν, πυρὶ
contextId.glQuote: the heavens and the earth are reserved for fire by that same command

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form and can begin a new sentence. Alternate translation: "He is reserving them for the day of judgment" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They are reserved for the day of judgment

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will burn the elements with fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The elements will be burned with fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: God will see all the earth and all the deeds of everyone, and he will then judge everything. This can be stated in active terms. Alternate translation: "God will expose the earth and everything that people have done on it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: γῆ καὶ τὰ ἐν αὐτῇ ἔργα εὑρεθήσεται
contextId.glQuote: the earth and the deeds in it will be revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Since God will destroy all these things in this way" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Since all these things will be destroyed in this way

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will destroy the heavens by fire, and he will melt the elements in great heat" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: οὐρανοὶ πυρούμενοι, λυθήσονται, καὶ στοιχεῖα καυσούμενα, τήκεται
contextId.glQuote: the heavens will be destroyed by fire, and the elements will be melted in great heat

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "do your best to live in a way so that God will find you spotless and blameless, and be at peace with him and each other" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: σπουδάσατε ἄσπιλοι καὶ ἀμώμητοι αὐτῷ εὑρεθῆναι ἐν εἰρήνῃ
contextId.glQuote: do your best to be found spotless and blameless before him, in peace

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "according to the wisdom that God gave to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: according to the wisdom that was given to him
